Target: Alliant National Title Insurance Company, Inc.

Evidence Text: "Alliant Title Acquisition On October 18, 2024, the Company entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Colorado-based title insurance underwriter, Alliant National Title Insurance Company, Inc."

Reason: The 10-K describes Dream Finders Homes' mortgage banking joint venture (Jet Home Loans, LLC) where FBC Mortgage, LLC owns 51% and performs back-office functions for the venture (accounting, compliance, secondary marketing).
Evidence Text: "Our mortgage banking joint venture, Jet LLC... We own a 49% interest in Jet LLC, and our joint venture partner, FBC Mortgage, LLC, an Orlando-based mortgage lender, owns the remaining 51% interest and performs a number of back office functions, such as accounting, compliance and secondary marketing activities."

Reason: The 10-K states that prior to Oct 1, 2020 the joint venture partner for Jet Home Loans (Jet LLC) was Prime Lending Corp., indicating a prior JV partner relationship supporting Dream Finders Homes' mortgage operations.
Evidence Text: "Prior to October 1, 2020, our joint venture partner was Prime Lending Corp., a Dallas-based mortgage lender."

Reason: The 10-K notes DFH entered Hilton Head and Bluffton markets via acquisition of Village Park Homes, LLC, indicating a corporate acquisition/affiliation relationship.
Evidence Text: "May 2019 – We entered the Hilton Head and Bluffton, South Carolina markets with our acquisition (the \"VPH Acquisition\") of Village Park Homes, LLC (\"Village Park Homes\")"

Reason: The 10-K states DFH entered multiple Carolinas markets via acquisition of the homebuilding business of H&H Constructors of Fayetteville, LLC (H&H LLC), implying a corporate acquisition/affiliation relationship.

Reason: The 10-K explains a $20.0 million bridge loan (BOMN Bridge Loan) from Boston Omaha Investments LLC used to finance the H&H acquisition, indicating Dream Finders Homes was a client/borrower of Boston Omaha Investments.

Reason: The 10-K states Dream Finders Homes acquired Orlando-based homebuilder Century Homes from Tavistock Development Company and also agreed to right of first refusal and build-for-rent lot arrangements where units would be sold to Tavistock or its subsidiaries.

Target: Varde Private Debt Opportunities Fund (Onshore), L.P.

Reason: The 10-K explains that Jet's JV partner is approved by USDA to originate USDA-guaranteed mortgages, supporting DFH buyers' financing options.
